column4: hi.how to make mobile phone memory card mount as read/write. it is mounting default as read oonly. help!!!
try accessing it as root.. see if root can write to it. if so. you can make a fstab entry, or install/run ntfs-config to make it accessable by all users.
tried with root. no luck.
tried with sudo mount -o remount, rw '/media/1234-5678/' still no luck
so its mounted but not writeable but is readable? check dmesg output for any error messages perhaps.
shoud i pastebin the dmsg output?
just try to write to it as  the root user. not remounting it. :)
tired to write to it using root using cp. no luck.
will touch work for folder?
touch sets the date, or creates a file  normally.  its just a simple test.
the command sudo touch testfile just worked. but no output seen.
so somtign is odd.. you made a file. AN empty one.. :) but still a file
okies. but how can we solve this?
does cp give some error? or just says read only? if the thing is having read/write errors. it may become read-only to prevent damage.
when i treid to sudo cp some time ago it gave error but just now i tried again and now its just hanging there
ch4eck 'dmesg' output now.
wait i think its worked
there may be some hardware issues going on.

yes. it worked. the files copied successfully. any guess what can cause this? becuase hardware is mobile phone which is working fine. and this same issue happen with my mobile too sometimes. then othertimes it dont happen.
hard to tell. cable loose?
no! cable is not loose! :-) anyway the issue is solved for the timebeing. thanks! :-)
dog chewed on it.
